metadata.title: CVE-2011-1022 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The cgre_receive_netlink_msg function in daemon/cgrulesengd.c incgrulesengd in the Control Group Configuration Library (aka libcgroup orlibcg) before 0.37.1 does not verify that netlink messages originated inthe kernel, which allows local users to bypass intended resourcerestrictions via a crafted message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgroup-bin - 0.38-1ubuntu2
cgroup-tools - 0.38-1ubuntu2
libcgroup1 - 0.38-1ubuntu2
libpam-cgroup - 0.38-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcgroup package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.38-1ubuntu2').
